abstract: The filename of the file wrapper object
overview:
## Discussion

This property contains the file wrapper’s filename, or `nil` when the file wrapper has no corresponding file-system node.

The filename is used for record-keeping purposes only and is set automatically when the file wrapper is created from the file system using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/init(url:options:)] and when it’s saved to the file system using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/write(to:options:originalContentsURL:)] (although this method allows you to request that the filename not be updated).

The filename is usually the same as the preferred filename, but might instead be a name derived from the preferred filename.  You can use this method to get the name of a child that’s just been read. Don’t use this method to get the name of a child that’s about to be written, because the name might be about to change; send [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/keyForChildFileWrapper(_:)] to the parent instead.

# filename

**Instance Property**

The filename of the file wrapper object

## Declaration

```swift
var filename: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property contains the file wrapper’s filename, or `nil` when the file wrapper has no corresponding file-system node.

The filename is used for record-keeping purposes only and is set automatically when the file wrapper is created from the file system using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/init(url:options:)] and when it’s saved to the file system using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/write(to:options:originalContentsURL:)] (although this method allows you to request that the filename not be updated).

The filename is usually the same as the preferred filename, but might instead be a name derived from the preferred filename.  You can use this method to get the name of a child that’s just been read. Don’t use this method to get the name of a child that’s about to be written, because the name might be about to change; send [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileWrapper/keyForChildFileWrapper(_:)] to the parent instead.

## Accessing Files

- **preferredFilename**: The preferred filename for the file wrapper object.
- **fileAttributes**: A dictionary of file attributes.
- **regularFileContents**: The contents of the file-system node associated with a regular-file file wrapper.
